titles.title: WIN Demonstration Program Extension Act of 1988
WIN Demonstration Program Extension Act of 1988
A bill to extend the authority for the Work Incentive Demonstration Program.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.

calendar.text: Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 739.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 97-0. Record Vote No: 211.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/2/1988--Introduced. WIN Demonstration Program Extension Act of 1988 - Amends part C (Work Incentive Program) of title IV of the Social Security Act to extend from June 30, 1987, to September 30, 1989, the date by which States may apply to the Secretary of Health and Human Services for their operation of a Work Incentive (WIN) program. Extends the latest termination date for such programs from June 30, 1988, to September 30, 1990.
